text: and in the last few minutes number 10
has confirmed that boris johnson has
received the questionnaire from the
metropolitan police investigating
allegations of coveted rules being
broken in downing street and whitehall
our political correspondent ioni wells
is at westminster ioni that's right just
this evening in the last couple of
minutes number 10 have confirmed that
boris johnson has now received a
questionnaire from the metropolitan
police and his spokesman said that he
will be responding to this as required
now what we know is that the
metropolitan police have sent these
questionnaires and are sending these
questionnaires to more than 50 people
who are alleged to have been at various
different events between april may 2020
and april 2021 now people receiving
these questionnaires including now the
prime minister will be expected to
account for why they were there and also
expected to answer all the questions
fully and truthfully as well now the
fact that the prime minister has
received this questionnaire doesn't
necessarily mean the police will find
him to have broken rules it doesn't
necessarily mean that he will get a fine
this is all part of their ongoing
inquiry but i think fair to say that
politically this is an incredibly
uncomfortable situation for the prime
minister to be in with many conservative
mps currently feeling that if he is
found to have broken rules if he is
found to be uh to get a fine uh then
they believe that his position could
become untenable
thank you ioni irony wells there live at
westminster
